com.kolbly.android.graphics
Class EditTextEx

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.widget.TextView
          android.widget.EditText
              com.kolbly.android.graphics.EditTextEx
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.text.NoCopySpan, android.text.TextWatcher, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.View.OnFocusChangeListener, android.view.ViewTreeObserver.OnPreDrawListener, android.widget.TextView.OnEditorActionListener
public class EditTextEx
extends android.widget.EditText
implements android.text.TextWatcher, android.view.View.OnFocusChangeListener, android.widget.TextView.OnEditorActionListener

This EditText extension has some utility methods as well as the ability to determine when the user has finished editing this particular text.

A user is defined to be done editing the text when one of the following occurs:

  • The EditText view has lost focus
  • The user has hit "Search" or "Done" on the keyboard
  • The user has changed some text -AND- some period of time defined by TEXT_EDIT_DELAY has passed

    Author:
    mkolbly
    See Also:
    EditText

    afterTextChanged

    public void afterTextChanged(android.text.Editable s)
    Our text watcher that only notifies of text changes after a delay given by TEXT_EDIT_DELAY milliseconds

    Note the use of a handler instead of a Timer or TimerTask. Handlers perform much better on Android over timers.

    Specified by:
    afterTextChanged in interface android.text.TextWatcher
    See Also:
    TextWatcher.afterTextChanged(android.text.Editable)

    setTextEx

    public final void setTextEx(java.lang.CharSequence text)
    Update the text without triggering any onTextChanged() events

    Basically, removes the listener, then calls setText(CharSequence), then re-enables the listener

    Parameters:
    text - Text to update widget with
    See Also:
    TextView.setText(CharSequence)
